title: PES cse or BITS EEE
content: Should I go for PES cse or BITS pilani main campus EEE

comments.body: counting your chickens before they hatch...
I am pretty confident about the options
Okay since people are downvoting , here's the truth I am already studying in bits eee, I had these options last year along with rvce ise, just wanted to see what yall would advice lol

I took pes because i didn't know my marks were enough for eee, so I pulled out of the bits seat allotment process 

I was beating myself up for it back then but now I am glad i didn't take it.

CS at pes is an absolute breeze. Everything till now is easy af and there isn't much stress at all. Easy 9+ gpa and get back 1 lakh a sem in scholarships 

Even first year at bits is quite hard, I've seen my brother's mechanics syllabus and it's insane what they make you do. My friend who got a seat there is struggling with a sub 7 gpa. Granted he doesn't study much, he does what i do. 

So basically what I'm trying to say is that maybe it's advantageous to be in the top at a lower college than at the bottom of a better college. If you barely made it in, chances are that most people are smarter

And most people who take electronics shift to computers anyways, if you're personally not interested in either i think you should pick the path which gives you better opportunities. Atm that's computers

Yeah actually you are right I should have taken rvce ise 
" being at the top in lower college is better than being lower at better college " is true
I didn't notice that you said bits main campus. Maybe take ece or something in hyd or Goa, the competitive culture is lower there.
